description: Parks Canada Agency (PCA) is seeking to put in place a professional services contract.Contract Period: From date of Contract to March 31, 2025 inclusive. Estimated Level of Effort (LOE): 40 to 80 days per contract year.
full_summary:
### Government Tender Announcement 
**Reference Number:** 5P300-23-0321/A
**Amendment Number:** 3
**Publication Date:** February 26, 2024
**Tender Closing Date:** March 19, 2024, at 2:00 PM EST

### Brief Description:

Parks Canada Agency is seeking the services of an Organization Development Consultant on a required basis. The consultant will be responsible for leading organizational changes to strengthen effectiveness, improve portfolio management, and achieve long-term asset sustainability.

### Trade Agreements:

This procurement is governed by the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA), the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), and the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

### Funding:

This project is funded by Parks Canada.

### Excluded Parties List (ENS): None

### Eligible Suppliers:

Parks Canada invites interested proponents to participate in this RFP under Contractual Mandate 2.4 (Organization Development Consultant) of the Task-Based Professional and Scientific Services (TSPS) Supply Arrangement.

### Evaluation Criteria: 

Proponents will be evaluated based on a combination of technical merit and price, in accordance with the evaluation criteria outlined in the Invitation to Qualify.

### Tender Details:

* Estimated Contract Period: April 1, 2024 to March 31, 2025.
* Estimated Level of Effort: between 40 to 80 days per contract year.
* Quarterly Refresh Cycles: Check the TSPS Refresh Cycle Schedule.

### Contact:

Helene Periard
Phone: 873-355-3504
Email: helene.periard@pc.gc.ca

---

### IMPORTANT NOTIFICATION:

Parks Canada Agency reserves the right to terminate or cancel this Invitation to Qualify without notice for any reason. Suppliers that submit a proposal are deemed to have accepted the Risk.

---

### PROCUREMENT PROCESS:

The procurement process will be managed in accordance with Parks Canada's contracting requirements, which are aligned with the following frameworks:
* TREK-AS, Personnel/Professional Services General Service stream
* 1BX - Procurement General Policy
* 6AE - Procurement for Goods and Services (Regulatory)
